description: I've been using keepnote for years as a way to replace screen notes, small files, and bookmarks that get generated while I'm doing household projects. It's hierarchical, searchable, with an HTML data storage. Keepnote stays on a raspberry pi server and I use it from multiple platforms. Super useful. My dryer broke a few days ago and I looked up my search notes from the last time I had fixed it. I store recipes there, notes about personal software (and pi) projects, gift lists, Christmas plans... You name it. It is a lightweight multi-platform OneNote.

It reacts very slowly when writing notes or when doing any other action like rename a folder, opening a new page etc. At time it takes 2-3-4 seconds time ore more between the keyboard input and the execution of a command.
Nice app for keeping a list of things that you may need to do. Notebooks and folders allow organization of the notes.
good customization, wish there was an app for phone

Have all obrigatory features note taking apps should have:
-> Insert screenshot 
-> Hierarquical Notes on left bar

BUT
-> You can't edit keyboard shortcuts -> screenshot shortcut doesn't work on my notebook (Insert and PrintScreen on same key, it doesn't recognize it)
-> Couldn't understand why there is a List View Panel, worst than it, I can't remove it, just hide it evertime I open the application
->Can't remove toolbar, it takes 10% of the application UI, and there are keyboard shortcuts, but you can't choose to remove this toolbar
summary: My friends, this one passed so close

description: I wanted a simple outlining app and this meets the need. Easy to work with and organize my notes. Only dislike is I can not find a way to delete a whole notebook and being able to customize the GUI would be nice.
I installed this and tried to Create new folder, Create new file , etc etc. No response, not able to do anything. Removed it immediately
summary: Is it not supported on Ubuntu 18.04 ?

description: I used to rely on AZZCardfile in Windows, but switched to Linux ZORIN OS. KeepNote is wonderful, very stable, saves the current file when changes are made. It does everything I need it to do, even image files are a breeze. Thanks for making it available!
summary: Very Helpful for keeping any Records
